meanings.definition: To take air into the lungs and then expel it
meanings.sent1: I breathe slowly to calm down.
meanings.sent3: The fish in the tank breathe in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The forest seemed to breathe in the wind.
meanings.sent5: I could feel the fresh air I breathe fill my lungs.

meanings.definition: To be alive; to have life
meanings.sent1: Every living creature breathes to survive.
meanings.sent2: Plants also breathe, but in a different way.
meanings.sent3: The old house seemed to breathe with history.
meanings.sent4: The city breathes with energy and excitement.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet of the night, I could hear the world breathe around me.
